volsense_core.data.data_utils module

get_or_fetch_multi(tickers, start='2000-01-01', end=None, lookback=21, use_cache=True)[source]

Fetch OHLCV and realized volatility for multiple tickers with optional caching.

On cache hit, returns the cached parquet. Otherwise, downloads data for all tickers and builds a unified dataset, then writes it to cache (if enabled) before returning.

Parameters:

  • tickers (list[str] or tuple[str, ...]) – Collection of ticker symbols to fetch.

  • start (str) – Start date (YYYY-MM-DD) for the time series.

  • end (str, optional) – End date (YYYY-MM-DD). If None, fetches up to the latest available date.

  • lookback (int) – Rolling window length used to compute realized volatility.

  • use_cache (bool) – Whether to read/write from local cache.

Raises:

ValueError – If the underlying fetch/build returns no valid data.

Returns:

Long-form dataset with [‘date’,’ticker’,’return’,’realized_vol’] across all tickers.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

get_or_fetch_single(ticker: str, start='2000-01-01', end=None, use_cache=True)[source]

Fetch OHLCV and realized volatility for a single ticker with optional caching.

On cache hit, returns the cached parquet. Otherwise, downloads data and builds the dataset, then writes it to cache (if enabled) before returning.

Parameters:

  • ticker (str) – Ticker symbol to fetch.

  • start (str) – Start date (YYYY-MM-DD) for the time series.

  • end (str, optional) – End date (YYYY-MM-DD). If None, fetches up to the latest available date.

  • use_cache (bool) – Whether to read/write from local cache.

Raises:

ValueError – If the underlying fetch/build returns no valid data.

Returns:

Long-form dataset with [‘date’,’ticker’,’return’,’realized_vol’].

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

load_from_cache(name: str) → DataFrame[source]

Load a DataFrame from parquet cache if it exists.

Parameters:

name (str) – Logical cache key (filename without extension).

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If no cached parquet file exists for the given name.

Returns:

Cached DataFrame loaded from parquet.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

make_rolling_windows(df: DataFrame, window: int = 30, stride: int = 5)[source]

Generate rolling subwindows of a DataFrame for evaluation or backtesting.

The function creates overlapping slices of length window, advancing the start index by stride each step. Assumes the DataFrame includes a ‘date’ column.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – Input time series; must include a ‘date’ column sorted ascending.

  • window (int) – Length of each rolling window.

  • stride (int) – Step size between window start indices.

Raises:

ValueError – If ‘date’ column is missing from the input DataFrame.

Returns:

List of rolling DataFrame segments, each of length window (except potentially the last if filtered elsewhere).

Return type:

list[pandas.DataFrame]

save_to_cache(df: DataFrame, name: str)[source]

Save a DataFrame to local parquet cache.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame to be saved.

  • name (str) – Logical cache key (filename without extension).

Returns:

Filesystem path of the saved parquet file.

Return type:

pathlib.Path
